Blog.post: urlLink Apple - iTunes - 100 Million Songs : "Kevin Britten of Hays, Kansas downloaded “Somersault (Dangermouse remix)” by Zero 7, the 100 millionth song purchased from the iTunes music store. He will receive a 17-inch PowerBook, a 40GB iPod and a gift certificate for 10,000 iTunes songs to create the ultimate music library for his new iPod. In addition we awarded 50 special 20GB iPods — one to the purchaser of each 100,000th song downloaded between 95 million and 100 million songs. " Luckey them.

------------------------------------------------------------------- You elected to receive this third party offer through the PostMasterDirect Service at The Free Site. ------------------------------------------------------------------- HCD Research is conducting a brief Internet-based survey of people across the United States regarding the current U.S. Presidential campaign. This survey is being conducted via the Internet. This survey is now open and it will close on Wednesday, August 4, 2004 at 5:00 PM EDT. The survey will take approximately 3-8 minutes to complete depending upon your Internet download speed. We are not providing an honorarium as this survey is not sponsored and is being conducted as a public interest research study. Results will be published cumulatively. No individual response data, individually identifiable data, nor personal contact information will be published or shared with anybody. To participate visit http://destinationsite.com/y?c=1M5Wk-6oo.2h3fxm.2fK.0 and use ID number 5519003816 You must be 18 years or older to participate and eligible to vote in the upcoming November election. You will need to have the ability to hear audio on your computer. Although we are not offering compensation for this study, we will make the survey results available to you online the week following the conclusion of the study and prior to release of the results to the general public. Additionally, the survey results may appear in national news media or HCD Research's web site, a web site that is not affiliated with any political, religious, government or lobby interest. We appreciate your participation. The information obtained from this poll will be used to provide the public with a national perspective of the U.S. Presidential campaign. To learn more about HCD Research, please visit, www.hcdi.net.
